metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11552 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: mpg321.c in mpg321 0.3.2-1 does not properly manage memory for use with libmad 0.15.1b, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption seen in a crash in the mad_decoder_run function in decoder.c in libmad) via a crafted MP3 file.

notes.Note: ebarretto> CVE was originally assigned for libmad, but further analysis has shown that the underlying issue is in mpg321 https://bugs.debian.org/870406#25 for more Details.

criterions.comment: mpg321 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.2-3ubuntu1').
